summary: The one thing I thought of that would make me hate Detective Pikachu would be them showing Cubone crying. I can’t take it in...
body: The one thing I thought of that would make me hate Detective Pikachu would be them showing Cubone crying. I can’t take it in anime. I’ll break if it’s on the big screen. Do not show me the Marowak trying to defend the baby. Let them be happy. Pokédex be damned.

reblog.comment: The one thing I thought of that would make me hate Detective Pikachu would be them showing Cubone crying. I can’t take it in anime. I’ll break if it’s on the big screen. Do not show me the Marowak trying to defend the baby. Let them be happy. Pokédex be damned.

trail.content_raw: The one thing I thought of that would make me hate Detective Pikachu would be them showing Cubone crying. I can’t take it in anime. I’ll break if it’s on the big screen. Do not show me the Marowak trying to defend the baby. Let them be happy. Pokédex be damned.
trail.content: The one thing I thought of that would make me hate Detective Pikachu would be them showing Cubone crying. I can’t take it in anime. I’ll break if it’s on the big screen. Do not show me the Marowak trying to defend the baby. Let them be happy. Pokédex be damned.

summary: detective pikachu needs a lesson from rodger rabbit
title: detective pikachu needs a lesson from rodger rabbit
body:
I was talking with a friend about the detective pikachu trailer and why I think the designs kind of straddle the line between “actually kind of decent” and “unacceptably creepy” - cause I do like pikachu at least and I’m def going to see the movie but there’s something undeniably off about how the pokemon look.

It’s clear the artists went into this with an intention of maintaining the distinctive silhouettes of the pokemon, which is smart. Those silhouettes are iconic and do a great job of communicating the pokemon’s personality.

The problem came when someone decided that the pokemon also needed to look “real”

and the thing is, pokemon aren’t shaped like real animals. they aren’t built in the way real animals are. anatomically, they don’t fucking work. and even if you don’t know anything about animals, you can still look at some badly done taxidermy and tell that doesn’t make sense, and that makes your brain freak out a little.

But here’s the thing- our brains are okay with the anatomy not making sense as long as we’re parsing the image as being abstract/symbolic. we’re not freaked out by a cartoon of Bugs Bunny because he’s not a rabbit. he’s a symbol that represents a rabbit.

Speaking of another cartoon rabbit- any of yall remember Who Framed Rodger Rabbit? Yall recall any uncanny valley shit with that? I mean, it had plenty of scenes that were highly distressing to my child brain for other reasons, but the cartoons looked fine along side the live action actors.

Circling back to pokemon, here’s the issue imo- They want to preserve the distinctive silhouettes, so they can’t change the pokemon physically to more accurately resemble real animals. But someone decides they have to make them look “real” and the only answer to that they could come up with was… to just dump all the HD textures on them as they could. Which was Big Foolish, because those excessive details are never going to respond to environmental details like lighting and moisture and wind realistically, so they just make the pokemon look More Wrong. It pushes them out of the safe “not real” symbolic zone, but without changing the silhouette they can never bring them all the way to “that’s a real animal.” The result is varying degrees of uncanny valley.

If they’d just dialed back those crazy textures like, 80% they’d be fine. Like, Niantic has *been* doing this and making it look good. But nobody every wants to just embrace the Rodger Rabbit symbolic simplicity!

summary: All Detective Pikachu needs to do to be successful is 1.) not be actively offensive in anyway, 2.) have a strong theme of...
body: All Detective Pikachu needs to do to be successful is 1.) not be actively offensive in anyway, 2.) have a strong theme of friendship and teamwork, and 3.) just have lots and lots of Pokémon in it. The bar is SO LOW.

summary:
Uhh. DO YOU REALLY WANT THE ALTERNATIVE GUYS. 
Cause Jesus Christ this would look horrible cgi. Jigglypuff is supposed to be...
body:
For anyone thinking jigglypuff shouldn’t have fur or be fluffy

Uhh. DO YOU REALLY WANT THE ALTERNATIVE GUYS.

Cause Jesus Christ this would look horrible cgi. Jigglypuff is supposed to be adorable

Thank heavens we got this instead

This is much more adorable and I would hug it.

I do not want my jigglypuff to be a flesh sack

#letjigglypuffbefluffy

blog.name: ask-spiderpool
blog.title: Ask Spider-Man and Deadpool!
blog.description:
Here lurks your friendly neighbourhood Spider-Man and the merc-with-the-mouth, Deadpool, as they learn all about the power of love. 
Ask, if you've got the guts.
Questions are answered in a random order. 
Living on Earth-9319 (NOT MCU). Tracking the tag #ask-spiderpool.

summary: To celebrate Live-action Deadpool’s role as Detective Pikachu, have Wade sharing a chimichanga and a cup of Joe with the...
body:
To celebrate Live-action Deadpool’s role as Detective Pikachu, have Wade sharing a chimichanga and a cup of Joe with the hard-boiled fluff.

Submitted by @toissins! Adorable!
